content:
Hello,

I searched for similar functionality in other email clients and found that Outlook offers a feature called "Light Reading Pane" under the "View" menu.

I tried to find a similar option in Thunderbird, but I couldn’t locate it. Is there a way to toggle the light background for the message pane in Thunderbird?

Thank you!

I have not selected 'Use system colours'

re : Now, the only workaround is to manually click the “Turn dark mode off” button for each email, which does work.

Interesting - I do not have that option in 128.10.0esr - Are you sure you are using 128.10.0esr ? But I do have it in my beta 139.0b1 and it's available in the 'release' 138.0 I think it was initially set up in 'release' 136.0


Also if I use it in the beta, then it stays in off position no matter what folder or email I select. In beta 'Config Editor' I have:

  • mail.dark-reader.enabled = false
  • mail.dark-reader.show-toggle = true

Bug reports I've managed to locate: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1715361 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1942206

content:

re : Now, the only workaround is to manually click the “Turn dark mode off” button for each email, which does work. => This functionality is built in Outlook. I am curious that Thunderbird has the same functionality or not.

Now I’ve found the cause of the issue: it’s related to the “Thunderbird Conversations” extension. When I disable the extension, emails display as expected. When I enable it, the unwanted behavior appears again. I believe I’ll need to bring this up with the extension developer.

Thank you so much!

Yours,
creator: NoSyu

content:
The composing of emails offers a lot of options via the Formatting Bar or via Menu Bar 'Format and 'Insert' options but it's not to be compared to a Word Processing Program because it's available code just not that complex. A Word Processing Program can control more precisely such nuances as line height, but and this is a big difference - people read those documents using the appropriate program eg: OpenOffice Word, OpenLibre Word or Microsoft Office Word.

Those kind of documents would be sent as an attachment in an email so the receipient can choose appropriate program to open them.

When you are composing an email, remember in reality what you see on your computer when composing an email, may not be what your recipient sees. Different OS may have different fonts installed. Monitor screens have different resolutions. Not everyone will view in HTML. People can choose to alter the font and pixel size.

Thunderbird already auto adjust the basics when it comes to line height. Choosing a different font will auto adjust the line height for fonts. Choosing a different size for font - larger smaller will also auto adjust the line height. This is also the same if you use Capital Letters.

If you require extra space between one line and another, - a line break - you click on the 'Enter' to leave a blank line. To auto leave extra spacing when creating paragraphs you can swap from 'Body Text' to 'Paragraph'

In 'Settings' > 'Composition' Under 'HTML Style' section You can choose how Thunderbird composes by default. Either enable Paragraph format or uncheck that option to use the basic 'Body Text' format. Paragraph format will leave more space between end of parargraph and start of another.

Please remember that Thunderbird uses px = pixels not pt = points when it comes to font size.

You can use 'Insert' >'HTML' if you understand and can use css html. https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/pr_dim_line-height.php

Please realise that whatever font or font size you use, when the recipient receives the email they can have preferences that overrule whatever you wrote.

What you term as readibity may not apply to others. As an example - Whatever font people choose to use in emails they compose, if they send to me then I've set up Thunderbird to only use the font I want to see. Whatever font size they choose to use, I also control what I see. The minimum size I will see is 12px, as I'm not interested in small fonts.

You can use Tables to help with layout, this generally works well, but obviously users can force some conditions and of course people can also just use PlainText which alters everything :)
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
It may be your Anti-virus product is scanning any file you open, so temporarilly Thunderbird has no access.

An established method of testing wihout doing anything would be to restart the computer using 'Safe mode with Networking', but if you use Wireless connection then you need to swap aover to using Ethernet cable connection to router whilst testing. Then start Thunderbird. If all works ok then you know it was probably the AV interfering.

However, regardless of whether you can perform that test or not, it is advised that you access your Anti-Virus product and set up an exception to not scan your Thunderbird profile folder. After all, you do not want any AV trying to fix anything in your profile as it's likely to result in loss of email. AV's do not understand that one single mbox text file may contain alot of emails. You do not want any AV doing anything with your profile folders and any file etc it contains.
creator: Toad-Hall

zprávu uložil do složky kdekoli v počítači

content: Co takhle to vyzkoušet, než začnete odpovídat. Tak znova, chci v aplikaci Thunderbird uložit zprávu kdekoliv do složky v počítači, ne do konceptů nebo programu Thunderbird. Asociace přípony .eml aby se otevřela v programu Thunderbird snad zvládne průměrný uživatel. Jde o to, že program nabízí uložení jen v .html i když dám uložit jako a přepíšu příponu na .eml stejně se otevře zpráva v programu Thunderbird v šíleném formátu html. A to že zatrhnu otevřít nebo zobrazit jinak nemá žádný efekt. Snad už je to pochopitelné, co chci.
creator: samsonbronislav

content: Thunderbird uloží správy hocikde v PC vo formátoch *.html, *.eml alebo *.txt. 1. Označím (zamodrím správu) 2. Klik pravým tlačidlom myši na túto označenú správu 3. Z rozpretrenej ponuky vyberte "Uložiť ako ..." 4. Rozkliknite okno s názvom "Uložiť vo formáte" a vyberte si z týchto formátov *.html, *.eml alebo *.txt a uložte hocikam.

content:
You need to create a new Address book or use a suitable address book to store the contacts. Then you can create subgroups known as 'Mailing Lists' which can be used to select a number of contacts in the select address book to send one email to several contacts. An address book can have several Mailing Lists and a contact can be in more than one Mailng List.

The manual method is select the folder/subfolder select email to see contents. In the header click on the 'From' email address and it gets added to Personal address book, click on Edit Then you can select the desired address book to use or click on 'Edit Details' to access the address book contact information.

If you were collecting all email address you were 'sending' emails then you can choose to collect them in any address book, but the default is 'Collected Addresses' address book. Have you ever sent any emails to those people - the particular group of clients? Maybe you already have collected the contacts email addresses, but are not aware of it ?

There is an addon extension you can try : It says "Collects email addresses (sender, recipients, reply to, or all together) of all messages in a folder (and subfolders) and saves them in a new address book. Richtclick on a folder and choose 'Collect Addresses'."

  • https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/collectaddresses/
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
IF prompted for mail account password: you enter the password...but did you select the checkbox for Thunderbird to Remember password before you click on 'OK'

OR...have you set up to use a 'Primary Password' in Thunderbird ? Generally this is not required unless you share your computer and computer user account with other people and you do not want then having access to stored passwords. If the answer is yes - you set a primary password then Thunderbird will prompt for the 'primary password' once per session.

content:
When you say the formatting is messed up, do you mean that words wrap at about 72 characters? If the answer is yes, then the following methods might be helpful:

Method 1: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1497365#answer-1716226 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1489408#answer-1707563

Quotation from one of the above links:

When composing a plain text message, wrapping can be set to the window width by changing mailnews.wraplength to 0 (zero) in Settings/General, Config. editor.

Method 2: https://support.mozilla.org/tn/questions/1450821#answer-1671918

"Settings" > "Composition" > "Sending Format" > change from "Automatic" to "Both HTML and Plain Text".

content:
For Shaw, use pop.shaw.ca, 995, SSL/TLS, normal password, part of address before @; outgoing mail.shaw.ca, 587, STARTTLS, normal password, part of address before @

For Telus: pop.gmail.com, 995, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address; outgoing smtp.gmail.com, 465, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address

Remove (not disable) AVG, at least temporarily, disable VPN if present, clear entries from Saved Passwords in Settings/Privacy & Security, and accept cookies in same section. Restart TB, enter password for Shaw (preferably strong password) in prompt, and account (not app) password for Telus in OAuth2 browser window.

content: You can use the Import feature of Thunderbird to transfer your message and address book datadata from the old to the new Mac. If in the past you had severe problems with Thunderbird on the old Mac it might be preferable to start with a new TB profile on the new Mac, all the more so since you use the IMAP protocol which facilitates the folder and message synchronisation.
creator: Mapenzi

content:
No, you do not want to use the folder that you found. That is for IMAP. If you set up your account in the new profile, you will get those messages from the server automatically.

If you have messages in local folders in the old profile, use the add-on ImportExportToolsNG to import them into the new profile.

content:
chrisnt1 said
One further question: Thunderbird on my old Mac had a POP profile while the Thunderbird on my new Mac has an IMAP profile. Is that going to be a problem?

There are no POP or IMAP profiles in Thunderbird but Thunderbird can work with POP accounts and/or IMAP accounts. If the old POP account has the same email address as the IMAP account on the new Mac I propose the following manipulation: on the old Mac open the profile folder, go to & open the folder Mail in which you should find an account named somewhat like "pop.xxx.xx" which contains the message files of the POP account. Copy the files (without suffix) Inbox, Sent, Drafts, Archives, Trash on a USB stick and transfer them on the new Mac.

On the new Mac open the profile folder and quit Thunderbird. In the profile folder go to Mail > Local Folders and paste the message files transferred from the old Mac. When you restart TB you should find folders like Inbox, Sent, Drafts, Deleted, ...in your Local Folders. From there you can copy the messages to the corresponding folders in the IMAP account.

If you are not sure which message files to transfer from the old to the new Mac, show a screen shot of the contents of the "pop.xxx.xx" folder in Mail on the old Mac.
creator: Mapenzi

creator: chrisnt1

content:
O)k this issimple, open your old device goto troubleshotting information and open the profile folder. It will open finder in the folder Thunderbird used on that machine.

Do the same on the new machine. Close Thunderbird on both.

Now copy everything in the old profile including sub folders. Transfer that data, perhaps use a usb disk or a network drive , to the new machine replacing the files in the newly created profile. This will generate a lot of replace messages, but that is also how you know you are copying to the right location.

Start Thunderbird on the new machine. It will be exactly as it was on the old machine.

This will leave some residual IMAP files that are essentially just a wast. You could completely clear the folder before you copy in the new data to prevent that, but you will not be prompted to replace anything so you will need to be more careful that the files are dropping in the correct location.
creator: MattAuSupport
